cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.IR 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with Natural Language Processing (NLP) and specifically focuses on measuring the semantic similarity of sentences. Additionally, the use of convolution and recurrent neural networks is a common technique in NLP research, which is a key area of focus in cs.CL. 

The paper also involves the use of machine learning techniques, which suggests that it could also belong to the sub-categories of cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). 

Furthermore, the use of LSTM (Long Short-Term Memory) networks is a common technique in the field of Neural Networks, which is a key area of focus in cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). 

Finally, the paper involves the calculation of similarity between sentences, which is a common task in Information Retrieval (IR), suggesting that it could also belong to the sub-category of cs.IR (Information Retrieval).
